intro: Triainolepis fryeri, commonly known as the African violet. It is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa, characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its compact growth habit makes it ideal for indoor gardening and container cultivation.
